act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Establishment of Local Authorities Guarantee Fund.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Establishment of Local Authorities Guarantee Fund. 3. There is hereby established a Fund to be styled the Local Authorities Guarantee Fund (hereinafter referred to as the Fund) for the purpose of providing security for the faithful performance of their duties by those persons required so to do under the Principal Act.
type.description: There is hereby established a Fund to be styled the Local Authorities Guarantee Fund (hereinafter referred to as the Fund) for the purpose of providing security for the faithful performance of their duties by those persons required so to do under the Principal Act.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Power of Minister to employ a secretary and servants.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Power of Minister to employ a secretary and servants. 4. (1) The Minister may employ a secretary for the proper administration of the Fund at such salary as may be fixed by the Minister.  (2) The Minister may employ such other persons  as  may be required for the proper administration of the Fund.

description.description: The Minister may employ a secretary for the proper administration of the Fund at such salary as may be fixed by the Minister.
The Minister may employ such other persons  as  may be required for the proper administration of the Fund.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Management of Fund.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Management of Fund. 5.  (1) The Fund shall be under the management and control of the Minister.  (2) All expenses incurred by the Minister in connection with the proper administration of the Fund shall be defrayed out of the Fund.

description.description: The Fund shall be under the management and control of the Minister.
All expenses incurred by the Minister in connection with the proper administration of the Fund shall be defrayed out of the Fund.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Obtaining of security by local authorities.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Obtaining of security by local authorities. 6. Every local authority which desires to obtain security in any sum approved by the Minister for the faithful performance of his duties by any officer in the employ of such authority shall pay into the Fund such annual sum as may be prescribed by the Minister. act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Obtaining of security by officers of local authorities.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Obtaining of security by officers of local authorities. 7. Every officer required to give security for the faithful performance of his duties under section 42(4) of the Principal Act shall pay into the Fund such annual sum as may be prescribed by the Minister.

description.description: of the Principal Act shall pay into the Fund such annual sum as may be prescribed by the Minister.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Payments into Fund.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Payments into Fund. 8. All payments into the Fund shall be made in advance.
type.description: All payments into the Fund shall be made in advance.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Claims by local authorities.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Claims by local authorities. 9.  (1) Where any officer in the employ of a local authority in respect of whom security has been obtained or given as provided by section 6 or section 7 of this Act is in default of duly accounting to the local authority for any moneys received by him on its behalf, the amount due shall be certified by the Chairman of the local authority and submitted to the Minister through the District Commissioner.  (2) The District Commissioner shall submit to the Minister together with the certificate of the amount due, a report on the circumstances of the case.

description.description: Where any officer in the employ of a local authority in respect of whom security has been obtained or given as provided by section 6 or section 7 of this Act is in default of duly accounting to the local authority for any moneys received by him on its behalf, the amount due shall be certified by the Chairman of the local authority and submitted to the Minister through the District Commissioner.
The District Commissioner shall submit to the Minister together with the certificate of the amount due, a report on the circumstances of the case.

act: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Re-imbursement of local authorities.
type.context: LOCAL GOVERNMENT (LOCAL AUTHORITIES GUARANTEE  FUND) ACT under Re-imbursement of local authorities. 10. Where the Minister is satisfied that any loss has been incurred by a local authority as a result of the failure of any officer employed by such authority faithfully to perform his duties, the Minister shall direct that the local authority be re-imbursed from the Fund to an extent not exceeding the amount for which security has been granted to such local authority and obtained by the officer under this Act.
type.description: Where the Minister is satisfied that any loss has been incurred by a local authority as a result of the failure of any officer employed by such authority faithfully to perform his duties, the Minister shall direct that the local authority be re-imbursed from the Fund to an extent not exceeding the amount for which security has been granted to such local authority and obtained by the officer under this Act.
